intro: Erysimum platyspermum, commonly known as the broad-seeded wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and bright yellow or orange flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the seed pods are broad and flat, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed areas.
